official-title.#text:
Expressing the sense of the House of
		  Representatives that the United States should leave no member of the Armed
		  Forces unaccounted for during the drawdown of forces in
		  Afghanistan.

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the
			 following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text:
believes that the
			 United States has a responsibility to keep the promises made to members of the
			 Armed Forces who risk their lives on a daily basis on behalf of the people of
			 the United States;

quote.#text:
I
			 will never leave a fallen comrade

text.#text:
supports the
			 United States Soldier’s Creed and the Warrior Ethos, which state that

believes that,
			 while the United States continues to transition leadership roles in combat
			 operations in Afghanistan to the people of Afghanistan, the United States must
			 continue to fulfill these important promises to any member of the Armed Forces
			 who is in a missing status or captured as a result of service in Afghanistan
			 now or in the future.

Whereas the United States is a country of great honor and
			 integrity;

Whereas the United States has made a sacred promise to
			 members of the Armed Forces who are deployed overseas in defense of this
			 country that their sacrifice and service will never be forgotten; and

Whereas the United States can never thank the proud
			 members of the Armed Forces enough for what they do for this country on a daily
			 basis: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 286 IH: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the United States should leave no member of the Armed Forces unaccounted for during the drawdown of forces in Afghanistan.
